isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - BE 200, CE 200, CE 300 Model - POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUNDS - Noise Kill - Extended Description

svcproc.title: Extended Description
svcproc.para: When the key switch is in the on position, power will be supplied from fuse F11 to the ignition/accessory feed relay. This will close the relay supplying power to the systems governed by the solenoid.

When the ignition/accessory relay is charged, power from fuse #20 can then be applied to the noise kill solenoid. The will charge the solenoid and allow power to flow to the systems governed by the noise kill solenoid.
Ground is supplied to the ignition/accessory feed relay and the noise kill solenoid from the ground stud on the flasher plate.
